channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Here to Help: In Baton Rouge, kids get a free and safe place to go after school
item.description: A poor neighborhood in Baton Rouge, La., has a volunteer initiative that's making a difference for the children there.
item.content:encoded: A poor neighborhood in Baton Rouge, La., has a volunteer initiative that's making a difference for the children there.
item.dc:creator: Alex Cox

item.title: Neighbors and church members transformed the home of a man with terminal cancer
item.description: In 2007, Larry Maxfield helped his brother Marty move to Utah. Marty had terminal cancer. Neighbors and church members helped transform Marty's new house into a warm home during his final days.
item.content:encoded: In 2007, Larry Maxfield helped his brother Marty move to Utah. Marty had terminal cancer. Neighbors and church members helped transform Marty's new house into a warm home during his final days.

item.title: How a 1984 NYC subway shooting let to the politics of resentment we see today
item.description: In Fear and Fury, historian Heather Ann Thompson revisits Bernhard Goetz's shooting of four Black teens — and explains how the incident reshaped criminal justice, national policy and media coverage.
item.content:encoded: In Fear and Fury, historian Heather Ann Thompson revisits Bernhard Goetz's shooting of four Black teens — and explains how the incident reshaped criminal justice, national policy and media coverage.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Julian Barnes' playful new book is also his 'official departure'
item.description: Departure(s) explores several of Barnes' lifelong obsessions — mortality, memory, and time. It's slim but weighty, digressive yet incisive. Barnes, who just turned 80, says it will be his last.
item.content:encoded: Departure(s) explores several of Barnes' lifelong obsessions — mortality, memory, and time. It's slim but weighty, digressive yet incisive. Barnes, who just turned 80, says it will be his last.
item.dc:creator: Heller McAlpin

item.title: Videos of cows using tools are drawing attention back to a cult-favorite cow comic
item.description: A recent study that shows how cows can use tools recalls the controversial 1982 cartoon from "The Far Side" comic strip called "Cow Tools."
item.content:encoded: A recent study that shows how cows can use tools recalls the controversial 1982 cartoon from "The Far Side" comic strip called "Cow Tools."
item.dc:creator: Ayesha Rascoe

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: All In
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WFIU listener Mark Minster of Terre Haute, Ind., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WFIU listener Mark Minster of Terre Haute, Ind., and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for January 24, 2026: With Not My Job guest Kevin O'Leary
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest Kevin O'Leary and panelists Adam Burke, Shantira Jackson, and Mo Rocca
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest Kevin O'Leary and panelists Adam Burke, Shantira Jackson, and Mo Rocca

(Image credit: Michael Tran)

item.title: A wintry mix: 12 reading recommendations to get you through the storm
item.description: If you're hunkering down ahead of the big storm, we want to make sure you're prepared. Yes, with batteries, flashlights, and toilet paper, but — perhaps most importantly — with good reading material.
item.content:encoded:
If you're hunkering down ahead of the big storm, we want to make sure you're prepared. Yes, with batteries, flashlights, and toilet paper, but — perhaps most importantly — with good reading material.

(Image credit: Fox Photos)
item.dc:creator: Ivy Buck

item.title: This sprawling, surrealist movie is a tribute to cinema itself
item.description: Director Bi Gan, known for his films Kaili Blues and Long Day's Journey Into Night, sets his latest film in a world where people can live forever, unless they dream.
item.content:encoded:
Director Bi Gan, known for his films Kaili Blues and Long Day's Journey Into Night, sets his latest film in a world where people can live forever, unless they dream.

(Image credit: Janus Films)
item.dc:creator: Teresa Xie

item.title: Alex Horne and Greg Davies talk about the U.S. tour of their British show, 'Taskmaster'
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon asks Alex Horne and Greg Davies about the U.S. tour of their British show "Taskmaster," where comedians are assigned silly or pointless tasks.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon asks Alex Horne and Greg Davies about the U.S. tour of their British show "Taskmaster," where comedians are assigned silly or pointless tasks.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon
